definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: There were a few articles in the newspaper inveighing against bureaucracy.
sentences.chinese: 報紙上有幾篇抨擊官僚主義的文章。

sentences.english: So far as methods of management are concerned, we should lay particular stress on overcoming bureaucratism .
sentences.chinese: 在管理方法上，當前要特別注意克服官僚主義。

sentences.english: This is a classic example of the killjoy attitudes of officialdom.
sentences.chinese: 這是那種典型的令人不快的官僚主義態度。

sentences.english: They aimed at the cure of bureaucratism.
sentences.chinese: 他們的目的在於根除官僚主義。

sentences.english: But bureaucratism , the carapace that lends a country however child, all over the mountains and plains rises magnificently.
sentences.chinese: 但官僚主義，卻借國家的殼子，漫山遍野雄壯起來。

sentences.english: Bureaucracy, after many years of decline, will be on the rise again.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主義在經過幾年的減退之後，會重新復燃。

sentences.english: This can be said to be one of the main causes of the bureaucracy peculiar to us today.
sentences.chinese: 這可以說是目前我們所特有的官僚主義的一個總病根。

sentences.english: The bureaucracy paralyzes the entire operation.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主義使整個機構癱瘓了。

sentences.english: Bureaucratism is the enemy of modernizations of socialist construction.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主義是社會主義現代化建設的大敵。

sentences.english: The biggest problem I face is the bureaucracy.
sentences.chinese: 我面臨的最大的問題就是官僚主義。

sentences.english: He blames Brazilian bureaucracy for this set-back.
sentences.chinese: 他責怪巴西的官僚主義造成了這種阻礙。

sentences.english: Bureaucracy may be said as a disease in our very vitals.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主義可說是我們的心腹之患。

sentences.english: An innovative trendsetter should not be working in a heavily bureaucratic environment.
sentences.chinese: 一個創新的潮流不應該在工作環境的嚴重官僚主義。

sentences.english: Formalism is a kind of bureaucratism.
sentences.chinese: 形式主義也是官僚主義。

sentences.english: Backlogs and bureaucracy means the process can take years.
sentences.chinese: 案例積壓加之官僚主義造成移民程序長達數年之久。

sentences.english: Bureaucracy spawns many rules that complicate our life.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主義產生了使生活化的條條框框。

definition: to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
